Job Title: Designer-Piping Design

Location: Libertyville, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Design, Engineering

Description:
UCC Environmental is a progressive well-run company, with excellent customer relationships and Utility specific sustainable technology solutions. It has developed a business strategy encompassing market growth through a variety of channels, including expanded international sales coverage. The Company has strong sales channels in North America, and currently possesses emerging sales channels in EMEA and Asia-Pacific (AP).
The focus of the position will be to organize, prepare physical design sketches, drawings, material releases and other documents from pre-contract Sales support through customer acceptance of deliverables to achieve quality, schedule, and cost commitments, as well as targeted contract profitability. The Designer will also be involved in and responsible for the processing of LiDAR data, including evaluating accuracy and sufficiency, and ensuring compliance to applicable project and company expectations related to processing of LiDAR data. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated capabilities in collaborating with others to perform engineering tasks within a team environment. Work experience with a privately held company will be beneficial.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:The Designer will:
• Prepare all assigned design work for contracts and proposals as directed by the Piping and Pipe Support Engineering (PPSE) Supervisor, Principal Designer or Piping Lead Engineer within schedule, budget, and quality guidelines.• Collect and register of data related to LiDAR point clouds.• 2D drafting and 3D design using the LiDAR point cloud environment.• Has knowledge of applicable design codes such as ANSI B31.1 and OSHA.• Displays positive attitude and learning characteristics, ability to complete assignments in accordance with schedule requirements.• Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned.• Conduct special assignments as requested by the PPSE Manager and/or Supervisor.
Education and Experience:An associate degree, preferably in Mechanical Engineering, Surveying or Architecture, or comparable experience.3-5 years CAD design software or comparable experience in piping.0-3 years with LiDAR registration and classificationExperience with intelligent piping design software (Plant3D, CAD Worx, Auto PLANT, etc.).General business acumen
Characteristics and Skills:Excellent computer and technical skills, including 2D/3D CAD software and MS OfficeStrong organizational, listening, writing and verbal communication skills.Ability to read and comprehend prints, plans and specifications.Ability to multi-task; cope with the demands of simultaneous activities.Must be willing and able to travel 25-50% of the time depending on assignments. o Working conditions while travelingWork hours are usually an 8-hour shift with possibility of overtime.Exposure to outdoor elements (cold, rain, snow, heat) o Ability to travel freely within the United States and internationally as needed.Ability to obtain TWIC card.
Essential Physical Abilities:Ability to sit or stand at a desk using a computer 80% of the time while in the office.Ability to accommodate varying work schedules.Ability to climb up and down stairs and ladders.Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.Ability to work standing all day.Ability to utilize full manual dexterity (e.g., sitting, squatting, bending, kneeling, lifting, walking, manipulating tools with limbs extended).
Core Values and Beliefs:
Must be aligned with Core Values and Beliefs that drive UCC’s existing corporate culture.People – we trust and invest in our people, unlocking their full potential and they always come first.Teamwork – we respect others and create a collaborative working environment of inclusion and inspiration.Integrity – we are truthful and respectful to customers, employees, community, and suppliers.Customer Satisfaction – we keep existing customers by delivering exceptional customer service.Innovative –we encourage resourceful problem solving in the face of adversity.
How to Apply:If interested in this position, please apply online via our website at https://uccenvironmental.com/careers/ and select Explore Current Openings to apply for this position online.
UCC Environmental is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. If you have difficulty applying for this job online, by e-mail, or need accommodations, please call us at 847-473-5900 and ask for Human Resources.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
